message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.SY 

The paper discusses the use of software-defined networking for ransomware mitigation, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The proposed system is implemented using OpenFlow, which is a network protocol used for software-defined networking (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the design of the system and its impact on network performance, which falls under the categories of software engineering (cs.SE) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper proposes real-time mitigation methods and describes the system's ability to react to threats, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY).
